property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: A U.S. service member speaking with a high-ranking Pakistani

note.text: Pakistan’s military is bureaucratic, with clear chains of command. Decisions require several layers of approval. Lower ranking officers will be briefed in advance about Pakistan's official positions, and likely won't stray from these perspectives. If changes to a plan or approach are needed, even high ranking officers may not make a decision if they feel it’s not within their authority to do so.
